content.description: Follow the crack. Reach up high to a surprisingly good crimp and top out.
content.location: North of the yellow red trail

content.description: Sit start. Lay back the finger crack and smear your feet.
content.location: North of the yellow red trail

content.description: Start with a fairly good high hold for the left hand, and low crimpy side pull for the right and a really bad smear for either feet. Basically lunge for the top and tip toe your feet up the edge.  This was basically done as a way to try and figure out the top out for a much longer and more difficult project; which may or may not come with time.
content.location: North of the yellow reed trail

content.description: Sit start by the two dead trees. Reach up and finger lock in the vertical crack with the right hand and lunch for the ledge with the left. Reach up to the loaf like pinch and top out on the blocky ledges.
content.location: North of the yellow-red trail on the far right side of the wide rock wall.

content.description: Start in the diagonal crack. Reach up to a loaf like pinch. Top out over the blocky ledges.
content.location: North of the yellow-red trail. Far right side of the wide rock wall.

content.description: Sit start. The crux is bumping the left hand up to a jug from the sit start. Traverse the obvious crack to the right about 15 feet. Down climb the croner to the right when the crack runs out.
content.location: Middle right of the long cracked wall.

content.description: There is an outcropping north of the Red-Yellow Trail with some established routes and more potential routes waiting to be explored.
